Surrey. I am the Director of the Surrey Centre for Cyber Security (SCCS) , one of UK's Academic Centre of Excellence in Cyber Security Research. Between 2021 and 2023, I also acted as the Co-Director of Surrey's Gold-level ACE-CSE Academic Centre of Excellence in Cyber Security Education. From October 2021 to June 2022, I was a Royal-Society Leverhulme Senior Research Fellow. My research interests are in area of cyber security, formal verification and cryptography, with a focus on: formal security analysis: development of formal frameworks and tools for security (protocol) analysis provable security: generic framework development, protocol design, security proofs formal verification (especially model checking), applied logics wireless, mobile and IoT security: e.g., distance-bounding, RFID/NFC security, 5G News ________________________________ March 2025. Together with my colleague Dr Rajaona, I have been awarded an Amazon Research Award , to streghten and extend aspects of our Phoebe privacy model checker . February 2025. I have been awarded University of Adelaide's International Fellowship Award. January 2025. Two papers accepted at USENIX Security 2025! Check out the publications' tab!" December 2024.
